title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
**About the Company** 




  





 At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it. FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day. We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field. Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?
 



  





**Site Reliability Engineer** 




 Are you an experienced, proactive engineer who enjoys identifying opportunities for improvement and bringing new ideas to the table? Do you keep up to date with industry best practices and take pride in turning insights into practical solutions? We're looking for a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) to join our Platform Delivery and Reliability Services (PDRS) team and help us evolve our Observability Platform with fresh perspectives and steady innovation.
 



 At FDJ UNITED, we believe in an automation-first approach to designing infrastructure services that empower our brands worldwide. Here, your voice matters. We want someone who takes initiative, proposes improvements, and actively shapes our tools and processes for greater resilience and scalability.
 



 By joining us, you'll become part of a forward-thinking team where your expertise drives innovation and your ideas make a real impact. We work agile, with a strong focus on quality, collaboration, and personal growth. If you're ready to elevate your career and help shape the future of our platform services, this is the role for you.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Architect, build, and maintain large-scale, distributed telemetry pipelines and observability platforms that provide real-time insight into system
* Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role.
* Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you.
* Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.
* performance and reliability.
* Design, and integrate cutting-edge solutions with an automation-driven mindset.
* Act as a subject matter expert, collaborating with development teams to optimise instrumentation, observability tooling, and reliability strategies.
* Proactively prevent and troubleshoot production issues to keep our systems stable and performant.
* Boost reliability across products and services by implementing best practices and innovative tools.
* Work closely with Development and Infrastructure teams to seamlessly weave observability requirements—metrics, traces, logs, alerts—into new systems' designs.



  





**Skills and Experience:** 



* Proven experience as a Site Reliability Engineer with hands-on skills in logging platforms such as Splunk, ElasticSearch, Graylog, FluentD, or Vector.
* Strong coding skills in scripting languages like Bash, Python, or Golang, including code review experience.
* Deep expertise in Linux OS and distributed systems.
* Solid background with Time Series Databases and visualization (especially Grafana).
* Experience with alerting and monitoring tools like Prometheus, Icinga, Datadog, or Nagios.
* Familiarity with CD/CI tools (Jenkins, GitLab, GitHub Actions) and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Ansible, CloudFormation).
* Knowledge of container orchestration platforms (Kubernetes, Nomad, OpenShift) and cloud environments (AWS, Azure, OpenStack) is a plus.
* Interest or experience in AI and AI tools is considered an advantage.



  





***Hybrid Work Disclaimer:***




*This role is based on a* 
***hybrid working model***
*. We require employees to be onsite in the office at least* 
***two days per week***
*, with flexibility to work remotely on the remaining days.* 




  





 Our Way Of Working
 



 Our world is hybrid.
 



 A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.
 



 Application Process
 



 We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.

title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
description:
**AI Engineer (All applicants welcome - from juniors to seniors!)** 




  





**Stockholm · Permanent** 




 Are you a curious, hands-on engineer who wants to build practical AI solutions - not just proof of concepts - and help shape a modern data platform from the ground up?
 



  





 Do you enjoy working across data engineering, automation, and emerging AI tooling?
 



  





 And do you want to do it in a niche financial company known for being fast-moving, personal, and genuinely fun to work with?
 



  





 If so, this might be the perfect next step for you.
 



  





**About Us** 




 We’re a specialised financial services company that’s been supporting Swedish businesses and consumers for over 20 years. Unlike traditional large banks, we’re small, agile, and collaborative - the kind of place where decisions happen quickly, people know each other, and you can directly influence how things get built.
 



  





 Our Data & Analytics function sits at the heart of our transformation. With a new tech direction and a rapidly growing team, we’re building a cloud-native, AI-ready architecture designed for speed, autonomy, and long-term scaling.
 



  





 You’ll join a close-knit team where personality matters just as much as technical skill. We value humour, proactivity, kindness, and people who genuinely enjoy building things together.
 



  





**The Role: AI Engineer** 




 This is a hybrid role combining
 **AI engineering** 
 ,
 **data engineering** 
 , and
 **BI/data platform work** 
 . You won’t be doing “pure AI” every day - you’ll also help shape the data foundation that makes real AI possible.
 



  





 You’ll start with modular, production-minded tasks like building small agentic workflows, chatbot components, or LLM-powered automations - and grow toward more advanced AI work as the platform matures.
 



  





**You will:** 



* Design and optimize data and AI-related pipelines
* Build and integrate LLM- and agent-based solutions into internal systems
* Prototype and deploy AI workflows using APIs and cloud tools
* Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify processes ripe for automation
* Work with Python, SQL, and cloud data services to support both AI and BI initiatives
* Contribute to the broader data platform and take part in reporting, modelling, and data flows as needed
* Experiment with vector databases, RAG patterns, agent frameworks, and new AI tooling



  





 This role is ideal for someone who wants variety, ownership, and the chance to build real AI capabilities - not just dashboards or not just models.
 



  





**Tech Environment** 




 We build primarily in Azure, with a long-term shift toward a more cloud-native and Snowflake-oriented architecture. You’ll work with (and help influence) our evolving stack:
 


* Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, Azure SQL
* Databricks, Python, Pandas, PySpark
* LLM integrations (OpenAI, Azure OpenAI, or similar)
* REST/GraphQL APIs
* Azure DevOps CI/CD
* Opportunities to work with vector DBs, embeddings, RAG, and agent frameworks



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




**Must-have** 



* 1+ Years of experience in AI
* Previous experience with data engineering, software engineering or ML / automation
* Solid Python and SQL skills
* Experience working with or around cloud data platforms (Azure preferred)
* Interest in LLM integrations, prompt engineering, and building agentic workflows
* A self-starter attitude - someone who can propose ideas, not just execute tasks
* Swedish fluency



  





**Nice-to-have** 



* Experience with Databricks, Azure ML, LangChain/Semantic Kernel
* Experience deploying AI services via API
* Familiarity with CI/CD, Docker, GitHub Actions or Azure DevOps
* Knowledge of embeddings, model management, or data governance
* Experience in finance, risk, or credit data (a plus, not required)



  





**Personality Fit** 




 You’ll fit in brilliantly if you’re:
 


* Social, positive, and collaborative
* Comfortable in a small team where everyone has impact
* Curious and proactive about how AI can solve real business problems
* Someone who enjoys both autonomy and shared problem-solving



  





**Why Join** 



* Shape the future of a growing data & AI function - early influence, high visibility
* Work with great people - a warm, humorous, supportive team
* True flexibility - room to explore AI, BI, data engineering, or even leadership paths
* A company in transformation - a new Tech leader, a new direction, and lots of building ahead
* A close-knit environment where ideas are welcomed and your work actually matters



  





**Compensation & Benefits** 



* Competitive fixed salary
* Permanent contract
* 25 vacation days
* Occupational pension (ITP-equivalent)
* Wellness allowance (3,000 SEK/year)
* Subsidized lunch benefit
* Hybrid work environment (Stockholm office)



  





 If you want to help build real AI capabilities - not just talk about them - and you want to do it with friendly, ambitious people in a business that values flexibility and ownership, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Testare Balanseringssystem
description:
**Backgrund & Uppdragsbeskrivning:**
 Uppdraget innebär arbeta som Testare inom Balanseringen där ett av våra större och mer komplexa åtaganden är systemstödet för mFRR EAM samt kommande anslutningar till dom europeiska plattformarna MARI och PICASSO.
   

  

 Vi behöver nu förstärka vår projektorganisation med en erfaren och samarbetsorienterad testare. Rollen tillhör linjemässigt enheten Balanseringsstöd (SBB). Uppdraget handlar om att hjälpa Svenska Kraftnät med samordning och praktisk testning vid utveckling av ny funktionalitet i våra system för Balanseringen och handelssystemen. En viktig del för SVK är också anslutningstester till våra nya stödtjänster där vi samarbetar med Elbranschens aktörer. I uppdraget ingår att arbeta med tester i samband med nyutveckling och mindre förvaltningsåtaganden.
   

  

**Roll & Ansvar:**
 I rollen som testare så arbetar du med att samordna och driva arbetet med test i både projekt och förvaltning normalt i samband med leverans av ny funktionalitet eller felrättningar. En stor tyngdpunkt ligger på de funktionella testernas utförande i systemen. Du dokumenterar testerna via våra testverktyg vad gäller testfall, buggar och sammanställer testprogressen löpande.
   

  

 Du arbetar även med tester i anknytning till ”onboarding” - av elbranschens aktörer BSPs - till våra olika stödtjänster. Här har du en koordinerande roll i arbetet och framdriften. I och med att testerna är av naturen B2B så är det bra att du har en tydlighet i kommunikationen och är pedagogisk lagd. Du kommer också att arbeta i rollen verksamhetsexpert där du ger stöd till bla IT-förvaltningsorganisationen och bidrar med kunskap i samband med felsökning av incidenter i balanseringssystemen och dess kringliggande integrationer.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**
 I uppdraget ingår följande arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Stötta utvecklingsteamen och verksamheten med att utföra tester
* Operativt säkerställa att test svarar mot strategi och testplan.
* Ansvara för genomförande av acceptanstest
* Säkerställa utförandet av system- och systemintegrationstester
* Arbeta med test i agil kontext
* Arbeta med test i traditionell IT leverans
* Hantera funktionella tester
* Koordinera test mot både IT och verksamheten.
* Hantera och koordinera buggrättningar
* Dokumentera test i våra testverktyg JIRA och/eller Azure DevOps.
* Arbeta med test inom förvaltningen

title: Produktägare Kampanj
description:
**För En Hållbar Framtid Tillsammans**
 Coop är Sveriges största kooperation och en ledande aktör inom dagligvaruhandeln, med över 4 miljoner medlemmar. Vi har ett stort fokus på hållbarhet och arbetar för att skapa en mer grön och rättvis framtid genom att erbjuda hållbara produkter och tjänster.
   

  

 Vi tror på att en mångfald av perspektiv och erfarenheter är nyckeln till att skapa en mer inkluderande och framgångsrik arbetsplats. Därför välkomnar vi alla oavsett kön, ålder, bakgrund och etnisk tillhörighet.
   

  

**Om Tjänsten**
 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens kampanjlösningar inom dagligvaruhandeln? Coop söker nu en strategisk och tekniskt kunnig
 **Produktägare** 
 som tar ansvar för området Kampanj – ett affärskritiskt område där avancerade system, data och kundinsikt möts. Som Produktägare kommer du att ha ett helhetsansvar för system och applikationer som möjliggör Coops kampanjarbete, bland annat SAP PMR (masterdata), GK Engage (Digitala rabatter och erbjudanden) och Bloomreach (kundkommunikation).
   

  

 Detta är en ny roll där du får möjlighet att vara med och forma området och ta ett tydligt helhetsansvar. Ett av dina viktigaste ansvar är att definiera och förverkliga strategi och färdplan för produkterna inom ditt område och att leda det tvärfunktionella teamets arbete i genomförandet. Du kommunicerar tydligt kring produktområdets roadmap och releaser samt ser till att utvecklingen ligger i linje med Coops övergripande mål. Du arbetar nära kampanjteam, marknadsteam och andra produktägare. Du kommer att leda ett team som består av flera olika roller; Tech lead, Business Analysts, utvecklare och SAP Solution Owner.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**
* Äga och utveckla kampanjrelaterade system och applikationer (SAP PMR, GK Engage, Bloomreach)
* Prioritera och planera utveckling i nära samarbete med verksamheten samt ansvara för budget
* Arbetsleda utvecklingsresurser
* Säkerställa att lösningarna stödjer centrala och lokala kampanjbehov
* Proaktivt driva förbättringsinitiativ inom kampanjområdet
* Följa upp och kommunicera resultat och status till intressenter
* Arbeta enligt SAFe-metodik och bidra till ett agilt och målstyrt arbetssätt
* Leda ett team, utan personalansvar men med tydligt leveransansvar


***Vem är du?***
 Du har ett starkt intresse för kampanjområdet och håller dig uppdaterad kring trender och nya möjligheter. Som person är du drivande, analytisk och strukturerad med god teknisk förståelse. Du trivs i komplexa miljöer och är skicklig på att omsätta affärsbehov till hållbara och effektiva lösningar.
   

  

**För att vara framgångsrik i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet som Produktägare, eller liknande roll, som innebär att du arbetslett utvecklingsresurser
* Erfarenhet av kampanjområdet
* Tidigare erfarenhet av OMP lösningar (Offer Management Platforms) t.ex. Adobe campaign eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet av SAP PMR, Bloomreach/CRM-lösningar eller liknande system
* Erfarenhet av arkitektur, API:er och integrationsflöden
* God förståelse och erfarenhet av tekniska utvecklingsprocesser inkl agila arbetssätt, kunskap om verktyg som Jira, Azure DevOps eller liknande
* Akademisk utbildning inom relevant område
* Förmåga att leda tvärfunktionella team
* Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga på både svenska och engelska


 Det är meriterande med erfarenhet från dagligvaruhandeln/retail.
   

  

**Vårt Erbjudande Till Dig**
 Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats där du får möjlighet att växa och utvecklas i en inkluderande och inspirerande kultur. Hos oss på Coop får du vara en del av ett engagerat team och bidra till en mer hållbar framtid. Vi erbjuder även konkurrenskraftiga förmåner, flexibel arbetstid och en god balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

**Så Ansöker Du**
 Låter detta som din nästa utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, senast den 4:e januari 2026 då vi arbetar löpande med urval och intervjuer. För att rättvist matcha kandidater med de krav som rollen ställer använder vi urvalsfrågor och tester i processen.
   

  

 För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta rekryterande ledare Viktoria Fridlund, på e-post Viktoria.Fridlund@coop.se

title: Senior Information Technology Engineer
description:
**About the Company** 




  





 As a Senior IT System Engineer - Infrastructure Specialist, you will be responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining our Microsoft on-premises and Azure infrastructure environments. You will ensure the security, availability, and efficiency of corporate backbone infrastructure including Hyper-V/Azure Local, Active Directory, PKI, DNS, DHCP and files servers, as well as our fleet of Windows Servers through modern and automated tooling such as Azure Arc and Puppet. This role demands an expert proficient in managing enterprise-scale hybrid infrastructure and capable of providing strategic technical guidance. You will ensure the security, availability, and efficiency of corporate systems, while driving innovation and mentoring junior engineers. A strong grasp of Zero Trust Security principles and modern infrastructure best practices is essential.
 



  





  





**About the Role** 




  





 As a Senior IT System Engineer - Infrastructure Specialist, you will be responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining our Microsoft on-premises and Azure infrastructure environments.
 



  





  





**Responsibilities** 




  





  




* Own a domain as the subject matter expert, staying up to date on new trends and capabilities within the supporting tools and incorporating relevant changes into our Corporate IT roadmap.
* Collaborate with other Corporate IT senior engineers, solution architects, domain experts and Helpdesk staff to test, deploy, communicate and support end user impacting changes into our Corporate IT.
* Coordinate medium to large scale corporate IT projects, defining business requirements, designing technical solutions and coordinating a squad of system engineers for its implementation, testing, global deployment and maintenance.
* Work in autonomy to translate business requirements into technical solutions, leveraging our existing ecosystem and licenses everywhere possible.
* Automate tasks or empower end users with self-service capabilities, in respect of our security policies, to reduce maintenance and support overhead across the team.
* Oversee the definition and maintenance of our documentation corpus, both technical and end-user oriented, to facilitate maintenance and troubleshooting tasks.



  




* Designing, implementing and maintaining Corporate IT services in the following areas:
* Windows Server Administration: Deploy and maintain on-premises and azure-based Windows Server infrastructure running on Hyper-V/Azure Local or OpenStack. Proficiency in managing Linux based servers, such as CentOS, is a plus.
* Cloud Services: Operate and manage Azure-based infrastructure, including Azure Arc for hybrid management.
* Corporate Services: Maintain key infrastructure services such as AD, DNS, DHCP, Radius, and File Servers.
* Security Hardening Policies: Define, deploy, and maintain security hardening policies for Windows and Linux servers, following industry's best practices.
* PKI Management: Operate and enhance the company's Public Key Infrastructure (PKI), supporting use cases like certificate-based authentication and secure network access.
* Secure Admin Workflows: Implement and maintain secure administrative access using Privileged Access Workstations (PAWs), secure protocols (SSH, RDP), and Privileged Access Management (PAM) tools.
* Active Directory: Maintain and support Active Directory, including integration with Microsoft Entra ID.
* Automation & Configuration Management: Use Puppet and scripting tools (PowerShell, Python, Bash) to automate and maintain system configurations.
* Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role.
* Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you.
* Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.



  









**Qualifications** 




  




* Educational Background: Master's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Experience: Extensive experience in Hyper-V server management and Hyper-V infrastructure support. Azure Local (Azure Stack HCI) experience is a plus. Extensive experience in managing Microsoft infrastructure, with expertise in Windows Server and the Microsoft Entra and Azure ecosystems. Experience in migrating legacy on-premises ecosystem to cloud/hybrid is a plus (Cloud identities, Azure ARC, Azure Local ...). Experience in deploying or managing privileged access management solutions such as Secure Remote Access (SRA) is a plus.
* Certification: Relevant Microsoft certifications such as AZ-800, AZ-801, SC-100, AZ-140, AZ-104, AZ-900, MS-102 are highly regarded. Additional certifications in security and cloud architecture are a plus.



  









**Required Skills** 




  




* Proficiency in scripting languages like Python, Bash, or PowerShell.
* Proficiency with KQL and working with Microsoft Graph API is a plus.
* Advanced experience in deploying and maintaining the following services: Hyper-V, NDES, NPS, PKI, Radius, File servers, Active Directory.
* Proficiency in Windows server management including provisioning, vulnerability management and incident management.



  









**Preferred Skills** 




  




* Project Management and Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead significant changes across thousands of employees and servers.
* Good communication and interpersonal skills, capable of engaging with stakeholders at all levels and coordinate large initiatives or projects within their area of expertise.

title: Software Engineer, Storage
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**Join the Pioneers**
 As a Software Engineer on the evroc Storage team, you will help lay the foundations of highly performant and scalable cloud storage solutions operating at mission-critical levels of availability and durability. You will be involved in all phases of the product lifecycle including design, architecture, development, deployment and maintenance.
   

  

**What You'll Tackle**
* Design, develop and maintain evroc’s cloud storage offerings including S3 object storage, block storage and shared file systems.
* Build components using first principles from the ground up to unlock optimization opportunities at every layer of the stack.
* Optimize existing cloud storage solutions for performance ensuring low latency and high throughput, high reliability and cost effectiveness.
* Work with appropriate stakeholders to determine user requirements. Leverage a variety of feedback channels to incorporate insights into future designs or solution fixes.
* Seamlessly integrate and upkeep open-source components within our evolving tech stack. Team up with fellow engineers to craft tailored solutions meeting our unique challenges.
* Lead the charge in defining and achieving our technical benchmarks.


**Skills We Value**
* Proficiency in distributed systems and Linux systems engineering.
* Coding in programming languages such as C, C++, Golang or Rust.
* Typically 5+ years of experience in building and enhancing clustered storage solutions such as Ceph, Gluster, HDFS, Lustre or MinIO or cloud storage such as AWS S3, EBS, GCP’s Blob/Block/File Storage.
* Extensive experience within the Kubernetes ecosystem developing and running highly available services. Helm, Kustomize, Knative, Rook and controller runtime knowledge is a plus.
* Deep understanding of databases, file systems and storage protocols. (Bonus) experience in Solid-State Drive (SSD)/NAND or Hard Disk Drive (HDD) based storage technologies, interfaces (e.g., NVMe, SATA/SAS), and security standards (TCG).
* Knowledge of performance tuning and optimization techniques.
* Active engagement or contributions to the open-source community.
* Collaborative, curious, and pragmatic Software Engineer who wants to be part of an innovative team.


 Please note you do not need to have experience with all of the technologies listed above to apply. If your background is in storage technologies and distributed systems, and you are passionate about building a better cloud, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

 We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.
   

  

 Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: Senior Azure Cloud Architect
description:
We are looking for more than just technical expertise — we’re seeking a
 **driven, self-motivated leader** 
 who brings passion, ownership, and a proactive mindset to everything they do. As a
 **Senior Azure Cloud Architect** 
 , you will not only shape cutting-edge cloud solutions, but also inspire teams and clients alike with your energy, attitude, and ability to turn challenges into progress.This is a role for someone who
 **thrives on accountability, takes initiative without waiting to be asked** 
 , and leads with a combination of confidence and humility. You’ll be at the forefront of our Azure practice, guiding customers through transformation journeys and building high-trust relationships that last.
   

  

**What You'll Do:**
* Lead by example in driving Azure architecture, strategy, and implementation across client engagements.
* Take ownership of technical vision and delivery — you don’t just execute, you drive.
* Work closely with customers to understand their needs, anticipate challenges, and craft practical, forward-looking solutions.
* Motivate and mentor a small to medium-sized team, fostering a high-performance, high-accountability culture.
* Act as a change agent — challenging the status quo, encouraging innovation, and pushing for excellence in everything you touch.
* Host design sessions, architecture reviews, and workshops, confidently communicating with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Stay ahead of Azure developments and be a champion for continuous improvement — for yourself, your team, and your customers.


**What You Bring:**
* Relentless drive and initiative — you don’t wait for problems to come to you; you go out and solve them.
* 8+ years in IT, with at least 5 years focused on Azure cloud architecture and delivery.
* Experience leading or mentoring small-to-medium engineering teams.
* Strong customer-facing presence; you can confidently engage, challenge, and align diverse stakeholders.
* Deep knowledge of Azure core services, infrastructure as code, DevOps practices, and security patterns.
* A growth mindset — you’re always learning, always improving, and you bring others along with you.
* Excellent communication, storytelling, and collaboration skills.
* Microsoft certifications (e.g., Azure Solutions Architect Expert) are a plus.


**Who You Are:**
* A natural leader who lifts others up and leads from the front.
* Self-aware, self-driven, and unapologetically passionate about technology and people.
* Not afraid of the unknown — you thrive in ambiguity and see it as an opportunity to lead.
* You show up with a can-do attitude, a bias for action, and the resilience to move projects forward no matter what.
* You take pride in your work, but more importantly, you take responsibility.


**What do we offer in return?**
* Individual training budget and exam fees for partner certifications
* Flexible working hours and remote working model
* Company laptop and needed equipment
* Local package such as six weeks of vacation, a pension package, private health care through EuroAccident, wellness benefits (Friskvårdsbidrag), and you can also pick more benefits from benify.se
* We are part of the collective bargaining agreement (Almegas Kollektivavtal - Tech Sverige)


 Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy before applying.
 **All applicants must have the right to work in
 **Sweden****
**.**
**About Nordcloud**
 Nordcloud, an IBM company, is a European leader in cloud advisory, implementation, application development, managed services, and training. We are triple-certified across Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services, and we are recognized as a 'Visionary' by Gartner for Public Cloud IT Services. With 10 European hubs and over 1300 employees, we are known for our innovative cloud-native solutions and we have delivered over 1000 successful cloud projects.
   

  

 Learn more at nordcloud.com and follow the #NordcloudCommunity.
   

  

*Nordcloud values diversity and is dedicated to providing equal opportunities for all candidates and employees.*

title: Senior backendutvecklare till TV4:s core-team Nexus
description:
***Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens streamingupplevelse?***
*Hos TV4 möts teknik, innovation, nyhetsjournalistik, sport och underhållning. Just nu på en spännande resa för att bygga nästa generations streamingupplevelse, med målet att leverera Sveriges bästa mediaplattform för miljontals användare - varje dag. Nu söker vi erfarna backendutvecklare till Nexus-teamet!*
**Om rollen**
 Nexus är ett core-team hos TV4 som bygger och driver några av våra mest affärskritiska backendtjänster. Teamet sitter mitt i TV4:s ekosystem och säkerställer att våra streamingplattformar fungerar för miljontals användare. Ett av teamets huvudfokus är vårt metadatasystem och de eventdrivna dataflöden som förser startvy, sök och rekommendationer med aktuell information. Teamet arbetar med eventdriven arkitektur och bygger flöden som är kritiska för prestanda och tillgänglighet i våra tjänster, särskilt vid hög belastning.
   

  

**Du kommer bland annat att:**
* Designa och utveckla skalbara backendtjänster i Go, med fokus på prestanda, säkerhet och driftbarhet
* Definiera och forma framtidens målarkitektur tillsammans med teamet
* Arbeta fram strategier för att hantera stora mängder trafik


**Om dig**
 Du drivs av nyfikenhet och engagemang och blomstrar i en miljö som är i ständig förändring. Du gillar att komma med idéer och förbättringsförslag samtidigt som du trivs med att samarbeta över olika funktioner. Du har en passion för teknik och distribuerade system, där du gärna löser komplexa problem.
   

  

 Hos oss möts du av en inkluderande kultur där mångfald inte bara uppskattas - den ses som en styrka.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du har:**
* Gedigen erfarenhet av backendutveckling i Go (eller liknande erfarenhet från Java/Elixir med vilja att arbeta i Go)
* Jobbat med prestandakritiska distribuerade system
* Erfarenhet av att bygga och drifta lösningar i AWS eller andra molnplattformar
* God vana av testdriven utveckling
* Intresse av att arbeta med arkitektur och systemdesign, inte bara enskilda tjänster


**Mer om erbjudandet**
 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm (TV4-huset) med gångavstånd till Gärdets tunnelbana. Kontoret erbjuder eget gym, parkeringsgarage, restaurang samt takterrass. Rollen erbjuder även:
   

  

* Kollektivavtal, med tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag m.m
* Valfri telefon, MacBook Pro samt rabatter via Benify
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och möjlighet att vara med på en en AI-first resa


**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
 Denna rekrytering är i samarbete med Safemind. Har du ytterligare frågor om tjänsten, välkommen att kontakta Natalie Pehrsson via natalie.pehrsson@safemind.se
 **.**
 Tjänsten ingår i
 ***Unionens/SJF***
 avtalsområde och fackliga frågor besvaras via mejl till
 ***unionen@tv4.se / sjf@tv4.se***

title: Software Engineer
description:
Despite healthcare spending at an all-time high, patient waiting time is getting longer, and patients aren't accessing the quality of care they deserve. At Kry, we believe we can play a fundamental role in changing this. For the past seven years, we've been on a journey to deliver and fix healthcare, for less.
 



  





 As Europe's leading digital healthcare provider and one of the largest healthcare providers in Sweden, we believe that providing accessible and affordable healthcare has never been more important. Our vision has been consistent and clear: great healthcare for everyone. Do you share our vision and want to be part of shaping the future of healthcare?
 



  





  





**The role** 




  





 We are seeking a Software Engineer to join our Healthcare Systems Team. Our mission is to develop, maintain, and enhance the SARA EMR platform, a comprehensive healthcare management system that empowers clinicians, administrative staff, and patients to deliver and receive high-quality care efficiently.
 



  





  





**What you will do** 




  





 Our challenge for you
 


* Develop and maintain the SARA EMR system, a mature enterprise healthcare platform serving clinicians and patients across Sweden.
* Build and optimize features across our desktop application (Windows Forms), web portals (ASP.NET), and backend services.
* Work with SQL Server databases to ensure data integrity, optimize queries, and maintain complex healthcare data models.
* Integrate with external healthcare services including e-prescription systems, population registries, SMS gateways, and appointment booking platforms.
* Conduct thorough code reviews, write comprehensive tests, and maintain high software quality standards in a regulated healthcare environment.
* Participate in system architecture decisions and modernization efforts as we evolve the platform.
* Collaborate with product managers, designers, and healthcare professionals to understand clinical workflows and translate them into robust technical solutions.
* Participate in an agile, lightweight Scrum process focused on delivering value while maintaining system stability and compliance.



  





  





**Who you are** 




  





 Your profile and skills
 


* Experience working with .NET Framework and/or .NET Core (VB.NET or C# experience is valuable).
* Strong understanding of desktop application development (Windows Forms, WPF, or similar).
* Experience with web development using ASP.NET, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
* Solid database skills with SQL Server or similar relational databases.
* You have experience building or maintaining enterprise applications with complex business logic.
* You understand the importance of data security, audit trails, and compliance in healthcare or similarly regulated industries.
* You've worked in an agile environment using Scrum or similar methodologies.
* You want to change the healthcare system by using your passion for tech.
* You like the idea of working on mission-critical systems that directly impact patient care.
* You are comfortable working with legacy codebases and modernizing them incrementally with a respectful dialogue.
* Curious, humble and eager to understand. Value an environment in which you can listen and collaborate in a respectful way.
* You are familiar with development tools and concepts such as Git, Visual Studio, continuous integration/delivery, and version control.
* Comfortable working in the Swedish and English language (written and verbal).



 It is not essential to have all these skills, but an aptitude and willingness to develop those you don't know is key.
 



 This is a hybrid working role, with the head office based in Stockholm Sweden.
 



  





  





**What's in it for you?** 




  




* Amazing, friendly, smart colleagues from all over the world.
* The opportunity to work on a mature, business-critical healthcare system with real impact.
* The chance to modernize and evolve a platform that serves thousands of patients and clinicians daily.
* As a team, committing to goals, sharing both success and failures.
* The opportunity to grow and learn from knowledgeable co-workers and cross-collaboration across departments.
* Ability to have a big impact on system architecture and technical direction.
* The chance to be a part of the journey of building the future of healthcare.
* Committed to supporting a balanced approach to work and personal life.



  





  





**Join us and shape your future as well as ours!** 




  





 If you think you're up to the challenge, come and help us to grow, innovate and develop! A diverse workforce is an absolute necessity for anyone with a vision like ours: to provide great healthcare for everyone. Therefore we celebrate differences and are committed to creating an inclusive environment where all employees can truly belong and thrive. We offer a hybrid way of working where we aim to be at our great office at least 3 days a week to cater for a great relationship with our colleagues.
 



  





  





**About Kry/Livi** 




  





 Kry/Livi is the European leader in digital healthcare, allowing patients to see a doctor, nurse, or psychologist online within minutes. We also combine digital with physical care, transforming how millions of patients access healthcare. Headquartered in Stockholm, we are committed to improving the world's health through innovation, one patient at a time. In Sweden and Norway we are called Kry. In the UK and France, we operate under the name Livi.
 



  





  





**Submissions and Questions** 




  





 Please submit your application by including your CV or LinkedIn. No submission will be accepted via email, nor when the job posting has become inactive. All applications must go via the careers site or an official Kry / Livi job post. If you have any questions regarding jobs or our recruitment process, please read our FAQ.

title: Power Platform AI Solutions Specialist Stockholm
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
 Som ett av Europas ledande konsultbolag inom digital transformation och med ett av Sveriges största team inom Dynamics 365, Power Platform och BI gör vi mer än att följa trender, vi skapar dem.
   

  

 Med över 50 000 experter globalt och som certifierad och managerad Microsoft Cloud Partner på högsta nivån, har vi kompetensen och specialiseringar att leverera hållbara, smarta lösningar som gör verklig skillnad. På Sopra Steria förenar vi teknik och syfte för att driva digital transformation med Azure OpenAI, Copilot, BI, Dynamics 365 och Power Platform. Tillsammans med våra kunder förenklar vi processer, stärker kundrelationer och skapar värde för både verksamhet och samhälle. Genom att tillämpa AI där det ger störst effekt hjälper vi organisationer att ta nästa steg i sin digitala resa.
   

  

 Vill du växa i en miljö där innovation, samarbete och samhällsnytta står i centrum? På Sopra Steria blir du en del av ett engagerat team som skapar hållbara digitala lösningar – i ett företag som utsetts till en av
 *Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser* 
 av Great Place to Work. Sopra Steria utökar sitt team inom Microsoft Business Applications och söker nu en person med erfarenhet inom Power Platform!
   

  

 Som Power Platform AI Solutions Specialist hos oss får du jobba i framkant med low code- och AI-lösningar byggda på Power Platform för att bidra till våra kunder och samhällets digitalisering.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har 3 års erfarenhet inom Power Platform och/eller 5 års erfarenhet av relevanta och närliggande områden.
* De senaste åren har arbetat med tjänster inom Power Platform, till exempel med automatisering eller kravinsamling.
* Har arbetat med Power Apps, Power Automate eller Copilot studio.
* Är van vid att arbeta i både svenska och internationella miljöer – du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.
* Har ett starkt konsultmässigt mindset – du är nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och gillar att jobba nära kund.


**Det är meriterande om du har:**
* Erfarenhet och intresse av generativ AI
* Erfarenhet av arbete i Microsoft Dynamics och/eller Dataverse
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Sharepoint online
* Relevant utbildning inom till exempel systemvetenskap


**Varför välja Sopra Steria?**
 Hos oss får du:
   

  

* Möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken inom Microsofts ekosystem.
* Spännande uppdrag hos några av Sveriges mest intressanta organisationer.
* En kultur som bygger på Power of Sharing – vi lär oss av varandra, stöttar varandra och utvecklas tillsammans.
* Trygga villkor, förmåner och en arbetsmiljö där kompetens, balans och gemenskap står i centrum.


**Ansök nu – vi ser fram emot att träffa dig!**
 Vi behandlar ansökningar och kallar till intervju löpande. På Sopra Steria ställer vi höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet hos våra medarbetare. Innan en eventuell anställning kommer du därför att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

 Rekryteringsprocessen består av tre intervjuer, personlighet- och logiktest, referenstagning och bakgrundskontroll. Denna kombination av urvalsmetoder ger oss en bredare och mer rättvis bild av dig som kandidat, samtidigt som det säkerställer att både dina tekniska och personliga styrkor kommer till sin rätt. För dig som kandidat innebär det en möjlighet att visa din kompetens och potential från flera perspektiv.
   

  

 Har du frågor om rollen? Hör av dig till:
   

  

**Theresia Wiclander** 
 , ansvarig rekryterare: theresia.wiclander@soprasteria.com.
   

  

**Pu Fernqvist** 
 , Rekryterande chef: pu.fernqvist@soprasteria.com
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Senior React Native Engineer
description:
Since our inception in 2017, Anyfin has empowered thousands across Sweden, Finland, Germany, and Norway to manage their finances better, saving millions through smart refinancing options. We’re growing rapidly and have big ambitions on the horizon, with new markets to explore and impactful products to launch. To fuel our mission, we’re seeking a dedicated and talented Senior React Native Engineer who’s ready to create seamless and innovative digital experiences for our users across web and mobile platforms.
   

  

 What You Will Be Doing
   

  

 As a Senior React Native Engineer at Anyfin, you’ll take a leading role in shaping and advancing our mobile applications, ensuring they are performant, delightful, and impactful. You will collaborate closely with designers, backend engineers, and product managers to deliver world-class mobile experiences across iOS and Android.
   

  

**Here’s How You’ll Contribute**
* Mobile Feature Development: Lead the design, development, and maintenance of new features in our mobile apps using React Native. You’ll build reusable, high-quality components and modules that enable scalability and accelerate development across platforms.
* UI Implementation: Partner closely with our design team to deliver pixel-perfect, accessible interfaces. You’ll ensure a consistent and polished look and feel, leveraging styled-components and Storybook to maintain a cohesive visual language.
* API Integration: Integrate with our GraphQL API and manage data flows effectively to power seamless user experiences. You will ensure robust client-server communication and optimize app performance.
* Architecture & Code Quality: Drive architectural decisions and uphold best practices for code quality, maintainability, and performance. You will champion TypeScript to ensure quality, security, and clarity across the codebase.
* Mentorship & Technical Leadership: Support and mentor less experienced engineers, fostering knowledge sharing and skill development. You’ll guide code reviews, contribute to technical strategy, and help set standards for mobile development.
* Experimentation & Continuous Improvement: Collaborate with product teams to design and implement experiments with Growth Book, iterating on features to improve engagement and retention. You’ll proactively identify areas for enhancement and drive initiatives to elevate the mobile experience.
* Testing & Reliability: Develop and maintain a comprehensive suite of automated tests to ensure stability, reliability, and confidence in every release.


 Who You Are
   

  

 You are an experienced React Native Engineer with a proven track record of delivering high-quality mobile applications. You have deep expertise in React Native, and modern JavaScript frameworks.
   

  

 You are passionate about creating beautiful, performant apps and understand the nuances of developing for both iOS and Android. You enjoy collaborating closely with designers to bring rich user experiences to life and have a keen eye for detail and polish.
   

  

 You are comfortable making architectural decisions, advocating for best practices, and mentoring others to help them grow. You are curious and proactive, always looking for ways to improve the product, streamline workflows, and ensure technical excellence.
   

  

 Above all, you thrive in an environment where learning, collaboration, and continuous improvement are celebrated.
   

  

 Why Join Us?
   

  

 At Anyfin, you’ll find a team driven by purpose, curiosity, and a shared ambition to make a difference. We promise a challenging and rewarding journey that will sharpen your skills, expand your creativity, and allow you to work on meaningful projects. Plus, enjoy the benefits of a centrally-located Stockholm office, competitive compensation, extra time off on your birthday, and many other perks we’ll share when we meet!
   

  

 Are you ready to help us revolutionize financial well-being for all?
   

  

 Apply today, and let’s build something amazing together. We believe that innovation thrives in person, so we work from the office four days a week to foster collaboration and creativity.
   

  

***Please note that we are not offering relocation support for this position.***
 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to simplify loan repayments and improve the financial well-being of millions. We help consumers reduce the costs of high-interest loans, and take control of their repayment plan.

title: Account Director
description:
Account Director – Sweden & Finland
   

  

**Who We Are**
 The Tricentis AI-based, continuous testing portfolio provides a new and fundamentally different way to perform software testing — fully automated, codeless, and intelligently driven by AI. It supports both agile development and complex enterprise applications, enabling organisations to accelerate their digital transformation by dramatically increasing release speed, reducing costs, and improving software quality.
   

  

 Widely credited for reinventing software testing for DevOps, cloud, and enterprise applications, Tricentis has been recognised as a leader by Forrester, Gartner, and IDC. We empower innovators to push the boundaries of software testing, fostering a global community of continuous learners who pioneer AI-powered, highly performant, secure end-to-end testing tools that accelerate our customers’ time to market — including some of the world’s largest and most influential brands.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a highly experienced Account Director to lead strategic enterprise relationships and drive business growth across Sweden and Finland.
   

  

 In this role, you will be responsible for developing and executing account strategies that expand our footprint within key enterprise customers while identifying and closing new business opportunities. You will act as a trusted advisor to senior executives, ensuring Tricentis delivers measurable value aligned with customers’ digital transformation goals.
   

  

 You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams — including pre-sales, customer success, professional services, and marketing — to deliver world-class client experiences and ensure long-term customer success across both markets.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Own and drive the overall account strategy and execution plan across Sweden and Finland’s enterprise markets.
* Lead and grow strategic, high-value client relationships, ensuring customer satisfaction and long-term retention.
* Identify and close new business opportunities while expanding existing accounts through upselling and cross-selling.
* Engage and influence senior stakeholders, including C-level executives, to position Tricentis as a strategic technology partner.
* Partner with internal teams to deliver seamless customer onboarding, value realisation, and ongoing success.
* Accurately forecast and report on revenue performance, pipeline health, and key account metrics.
* Represent Tricentis at industry events, executive roundtables, and strategic forums to enhance brand visibility across the Nordics.
* Stay informed on market trends, competitors, and emerging technologies to inform strategic decision-making.


**What You Will Bring**
* 8+ years of experience in enterprise software sales or account management, ideally within testing, DevOps, automation, or SaaS.
* Proven track record of driving significant revenue growth across large, complex enterprise accounts.
* Strong strategic and commercial acumen with experience developing long-term account and territory plans.
* Deep understanding of enterprise ecosystems (e.g. SAP, Oracle, Salesforce) and DevOps/CI-CD methodologies.
* Demonstrated ability to build trusted relationships and influence executive stakeholders across both business and technical domains.
* Exceptional negotiation, communication, and presentation skills.
* Fluency in Swedish or Finnish, with strong proficiency in English (both written and spoken).


**Your Benefits**
* Performance-related bonus or commission – depending on the role.
* Flexible working hours – no core hours; agree on a working pattern that suits your needs as well as the business.
* Work injury & accident coverage.
* Vacation – 25 days per calendar year.
* Giving Back – 2 days of paid Volunteering Leave per year to support your local community or a cause that matters to you.
* Employee Engagement & Wellbeing – recognition of excellence across all levels, regular opportunities to celebrate and socialise (parties, sports events, BBQs), global meetings, Global Learning Days, and much more.


**Tricentis Core Values**
* Our core values define how we work and what makes Tricentis an inspiring and successful place to be:
* Demonstrate Self-Awareness: Own your strengths and limitations.
* Finish What We Start: Do what we say we are going to do.
* Move Fast: Create momentum and efficiency.
* Run Towards Change: Challenge the status quo.
* Serve Our Customers & Communities: Create a positive experience with every interaction.
* Solve Problems Together: We win or lose as one team.
* Think Big & Believe: Set extraordinary goals and believe you can achieve them

title: Java Lead with Apache Kafka & Camel experience | Stockholm
description:
**Job Description**
**Role – Senior Consultant
   

  

 Technology – Apache Camel , Kafka
   

  

 Location – Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Business Unit – INS ADM**
 Today, the corporate landscape is dynamic and the world ahead is full of possibilities! None of the amazing things we do at Infosys would be possible without an equally amazing culture, the environment where ideas can flourish and where you are empowered to move forward as far as your ideas will take you.
   

  

 At Infosys, we assure that your career will never stand still, we will inspire you to build what’s next and we will navigate further together. Our journey of learnability, values and trusted relationships with our clients continue to be the cornerstones of our organization and these values are upheld only because of our people.
   

  

**Role**
 In the role of Senior Consultant, you will interface with key stakeholders and apply your technical proficiency across different stages of the Software Development Life Cycle including Requirements Elicitation, Application Architecture definition and Design. You will play an important role in developing an IDP, which will be used by multiple teams to integrate their systems in an efficient manner.

**Why Infosys**

 With over four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
   

  

**“All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Infosys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.”**

title: Java Developer, Broadband
description:
*Are you a seasoned Java developer who values stability over startup chaos? Join our Broadband Provisioning team at Tele2, where we keep Sweden connected — not through cables and routers, but by making sure every broadband order flows smoothly from start to finish. You’ll work in a pragmatic environment that values reliability, simplicity, and long-term impact over buzzwords and hype.*
**About The Job**
 We’re looking for a Java developer to help maintain and evolve our broadband provisioning systems — the backbone that ensures customers get the right service at the right time. You’ll work with a small, experienced team focused on improving and stabilizing our order management and fulfillment flows.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain Java-based backend systems for broadband order handling.
* Work closely with operations and product teams to ensure smooth provisioning processes.
* Improve existing systems through refactoring, testing, and documentation.
* Contribute to modernization efforts over time, balancing pragmatism with technical improvement.


**Who are you?**
 To thrive in this role, we believe you:
   

  

* Have solid experience in Java development (preferably 5+ years).
* Understand backend architecture and integration patterns (REST, messaging, etc.).
* Are comfortable working with legacy systems and gradual improvements.
* Communicate clearly and take responsibility for stable, maintainable code.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with Spring Boot, Maven, or similar frameworks.
* Familiarity with telecom or provisioning systems.
* Exposure to CI/CD pipelines and basic cloud infrastructure.


**Personal qualities**
 You’re grounded, reliable, and pragmatic — someone who takes pride in keeping things running. You value teamwork, continuity, and incremental progress over flashy rewrites.

title: Postdoc in secure autonomous cyber-physical systems
description:
**Job Description**
 The Division of Network and Systems Engineering is seeking a highly motivated postdoc with a very strong background and interest in learning and optimization for secure and robust autonomous cyber-physical systems. The successful candidate will join a project developing model-based and data-driven techniques for detecting, mitigating, and reasoning about adversarial behavior in interconnected autonomous systems. Two research directions are possible depending on the candidate’s expertise:
   

  

 Cyber-Physical Systems Security: Develop new methods for securing sensing, control, and decision-making pipelines in CPS. This includes modeling cyber-physical interactions under uncertainty, designing detection algorithms for false data injections attacks, and building resilient control or monitoring mechanisms that can withstand and recover from adversarial attacks
   

  

 Secure and Robust Machine Learning: Investigate adversarial robustness, adaptation to distribution shift, secure coordination, and robust learning in single and multi-agent environments. Topics include robust reinforcement learning, robust perception, secure decision policies, and collective defense strategies.
   

  

 The Division of Network and Systems Engineering conducts fundamental research in networked systems, wireless communications and cyber security. Industrial projects involve partners such as Ericsson, Atlas Copco and Telenor. Part of the research is conducted within the framework of the Wallenberg AI, Autonomous Systems and Software Program and in Digital Futures. We have an extensive academic network and collaborate with researchers at MIT, UIUC, EPFL, among others.
   

  

 For more information
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Requirements**
* A doctoral degree or an equivalent foreign degree. This eligibility requirement must be met no later than the time the employment decision is made.
* Significant, documented research expertise in cyber-physical systems and/or machine learning.
* Strongly motivated, able to work independently, and with very good collaborative abilities.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* A doctoral degree or an equivalent foreign degree, obtained within the last three years prior to the application deadline
* Teaching abilities and documented supervision of student work is commendable.
* Research expertise
* Awareness of diversity and equal opportunity issues, with specific focus on gender equality is commendable.
* Collaborative abilities
* Independence


 Great emphasis will be placed on personal skills.
   

  

 Join us at KTH
   

  

 KTH shapes the future through education, research and innovation. As a leading international technical university, we play an active role in advancing the transition towards a sustainable society. At KTH, you have the opportunity to grow and develop in a creative and dynamic environment, with good working conditions and attractive benefits. Equality, diversity and equal opportunities are essential to quality and form an integral part of KTH’s core values as a university and public authority.
   

  

 Learn more about our benefits and what it's like to work and grow at KTH.
   

  

 Trade union representatives
   

  

 Contact information to trade union representatives.
   

  

 To apply for the position
   

  

 Log into KTH's recruitment system to apply for this position. You are responsible for ensuring that your application is complete according to the instructions in the ad.
   

  

 The application must include:
   

  

* CV including relevant professional experience and knowledge.
* Copy of diplomas and grades from your previous university studies. Translations into English or Swedish if the original documents have not been issued in any of these languages.
* Brief account of why you want to conduct research, your academic interests and how they relate to your previous studies and future goals. Max two pages long.
* Three scientific publications relevant to the position.
* Contact information for at least three reference persons.


 Your complete application must be received at KTH no later than the last day of application, midnight CET/CEST (Central European Time/Central European Summer Time).
   

  

**About The Employment**
 The position offered is for, at the most, two years.
   

  

 A position as a postdoctoral fellow is a time-limited qualified appointment focusing mainly on research, intended as a first career step after a dissertation.
   

  

 Others
   

  

 For information about processing of personal data in the recruitment process.
   

  

 It may be the case that a position at KTH is classified as a security-sensitive role in accordance with the Protective Security Act (2018:585). If this applies to the specific position, a security clearance will be conducted for the applicant in accordance with the same law with the applicant's consent. In such cases, a prerequisite for employment is that the applicant is approved following the security clearance.
   

  

 We firmly decline all contact with staffing and recruitment agencies and job ad salespersons.
   

  

 Disclaimer: In case of discrepancy between the Swedish original and the English translation of the job announcement, the Swedish version takes precedence.

title: Senior Software Engineer (C++), Frostbite
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 Frostbite is EA's proprietary game engine. Its versatile tools and cutting-edge technology power creation on some of the world's most iconic and visually stunning games, including titles from EA SPORTS and Battlefield. Frostbite provides a unified platform that empowers developers to create hyper-realistic worlds, intricate gameplay, and lifelike animations with unmatched speed and quality. By joining Frostbite, you'll be at the forefront of game engine innovation, collaborating with top-tier developers to push the boundaries of interactive realism and immersive gameplay. Shape the future of gaming technology and leave your mark on the next generation of games.
   

  

 You Will Work On Systems For Data Management And Game Asset Processing, Improving Our Content Creator Workflows And Allowing Faster Iteration Times. Some Examples Of The Systems That You Might Work With
   

  

* The system that provides on-disk data to our editor
* The pipeline for creating game-ready data
* A caching system for built data
* A service for On-demand loading


 This is a hybrid remote/in-office role in Vancouver or Stockholm and you will report to a Development Director.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* You will provide architectural guidance and technical expertise to enhance performance, profiling, and optimization
* You will partner with the wider Frostbite engineering team to define strategic direction
* You will collaborate on design, testing, and maintenance efforts
* You will enhance tools, processes, and best practices
* You will work with leadership to develop roadmaps
* You will communicate with game and Frostbite teams to understand their needs and support them in using our technologies
* You will acquire and share domain expertise


**Qualifications**
* 7+ years of experience with C++ programming, data-guided design, and software architecture
* Experienced in building high-performing concurrent software
* Comfortable working within an established codebase
* Experience with Agile development practices
* Experience of data processing and data management
* Experience implementing databases or file systems
* Some experience with web services running locally and in Azure
* Some experience with content pipelines


**Compensation And Benefits**
 The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).
   

  

**PAY RANGES**
* British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria) \*$138,700 - $199,900 CAD


 In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.
   

  

**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Podcast Booking & Executive Communications Manager (Tech Focus) - 100% remote
description:
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance


At Tether, we’re not just building products, we’re pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses—from exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs—to seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.


Innovate with Tether

**Tether Finance:** Our innovative product suite features the world’s most trusted stablecoin, USDT, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.


But that’s just the beginning:

**Tether Power:** Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.

**Tether Data:** Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like KEET, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.

**Tether Education:** Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.

**Tether Evolution:** At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.


Why Join Us?


Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you’re passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We’ve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.


If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.


Are you ready to be part of the future?

**About the job**


We are looking for a highly connected, detail-oriented Podcast Booking & Executive Communications Manager to secure, manage, and optimize podcast appearances for our internal executives, particularly those across engineering, AI, and technical leadership. This role requires someone who understands the technology landscape, can speak credibly with producers and hosts, and knows how to strategically match the right executives to the right shows.


You will own the entire lifecycle of podcast placement: identifying opportunities, pitching shows, securing bookings, prepping executives, ensuring messaging alignment, and managing all logistics from outreach to post-production follow-up.

**Responsibilities**


Podcast Strategy & Booking

* Develop and execute a podcast placement strategy aligned with company goals, product announcements, thought leadership themes, and brand positioning.
* Leverage existing relationships and build new ones with podcast hosts, producers, editors, and bookers across top-tier and mid-tier tech, engineering, and business shows.
* Pitch and secure podcast appearances for executives based on their expertise level, narrative fit, and audience relevance.
* Maintain an active pipeline of podcast opportunities ranging from major outlets (e.g., tech industry flagships) to specialized engineering and AI-focused shows.

**Executive Preparation & Messaging**

* Prepare executives for conversations by developing briefing materials: key talking points, audience insights, host background, sample questions, and narrative frameworks.
* Collaborate with Comms, Product, and Engineering teams to ensure technical accuracy while maintaining editorial clarity and storytelling.
* Conduct pre-interviews or prep sessions to ensure executives are fully ready for both high-level and technically deep podcast conversations.

**Logistics & Project Management**

* Own all scheduling, coordination, and communication with podcast teams and internal stakeholders.
* Manage timelines, deliverables, follow-up, and promotion cycles.
* Track performance metrics, audience reach, sentiment, and downstream content opportunities (clips, social content, repurposing, etc.).

**Relationship Building & Network Expansion**

* Grow and maintain a strong network of podcast producers, bookers, hosts, and media contacts across the technology and business landscape.
* Understand each show’s editorial style, audience sophistication level, and preferred guest profile.
* Position executives as valuable guests to both high-profile and emerging podcasts in engineering, AI, cloud, security, and broader tech.

**Cross-Functional Collaboration**

* Identify moments where announcements, launches, or technical milestones can be amplified through podcast placements.
* Repurpose podcast appearances into blogs, social clips, speaking opportunities, or thought-leadership pipelines.
* 3–5+ years experience in podcast booking, PR, communications, media relations, or editorial production, ideally in a tech or engineering-driven company.
* Demonstrated success securing podcast placements for executives, founders, or technical leaders.
* Strong understanding of technology topics such as AI, machine learning, cloud, software engineering, cybersecurity, or developer tools.
* Existing connections with podcast hosts, producers, and media across top-tier and niche tech shows.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills; skilled at tailoring complex technical concepts into engaging messages.
* Exceptional project management and organizational abilities.
* Comfortable engaging with senior executives, engineers, product leaders, and journalists.

**Important information for candidates**  

Recruitment scams have become increasingly common. To protect yourself, please keep the following in mind when applying for roles:

* **Apply only through our official channels.** We do not use third-party platforms or agencies for recruitment unless clearly stated. All open roles are listed on our official careers page: https://tether.recruitee.com/
* **Verify the recruiter’s identity.** All our recruiters have verified LinkedIn profiles. If you’re unsure, you can confirm their identity by checking their profile or contacting us through our website.
* **Be cautious of unusual communication methods.** We do not conduct interviews over WhatsApp, Telegram, or SMS. All communication is done through official company emails and platforms.
* **Double-check email addresses.** All communication from us will come from emails ending in **@**tether.to **or @**tether.io
* **We will never request payment or financial details.** If someone asks for personal financial information or payment at any point during the hiring process, it is a scam. Please report it immediately.

**When in doubt, feel free to reach out through our official website.**

title: Cyber Security Operations Engineer
description:
Blue Eye offers creative solutions through engineering expertise. We carry our experience and knowledge with the best professionals in different disciplines to offer optimal solutions to our clients. As an employee or a sub-contractor, working within the Blue Eye family, we encourage you to share your ideas and experiences. This enables our teams to increase their knowledge and deliver high quality product development as well as strengthen our competitiveness as a company.


### **Description**


We have an exciting opening for an expert level "Cyber Security Operations" professional to work onsite with our Automotive client in Gothenburg. The consultant will be working in the Cloud & Connectivity team within IT & Digital Solutions.  

The scope is to be responsible and accountable for meetings, planning, analysis work & daily contact with other teams within IT, business representatives and stakeholders. Representative during any customer audits.

### **Tasks**

* Overall responsibility for TSP security, ensuring the strict adherence to all customer security and legal requirements.
* Awareness of and compliance to relevant regulations (NIS2 and GDPR)
* Security reporting on a regular basis, but also during any incidents or events to provide updates.
* Management and use of security tools and systems, such as PKI system, app reinforcement system, vulnerability scanners, and vulnerability management platform, etc.

### **Qualifications**


oExperience with cloud security (AWS, Azure, GCP)  

oExperience with PKI, IAM, GDPR, NIS2  

oHands‑on with SIEM (Splunk, Elastic, Sentinel, etc.)  

oHands-on experience with implementing of logging, alerting and dashboards  

oCloud-native logging/monitoring  

oSecurity architecture and compliance  

oExcellent communication skills in English written and spoken  

oExperience from Agile development processes, such as Scrum or Kanban  

oDevOps Git repos, build and deploy pipelines (CI/CD)  

oFamiliarity with DevSecOps practices, CI/CD security controls  

oExperience with messaging technologies such as Kafka and MQTT

### **Terms**


As a Blue Eye employee, you are not just one of many, you´ll be part of our family. We believe that the happier you are at your work, the better performance you´ll have. We achieve this through constantly and carefully listening to the needs of each of our employees. For Blue Eye the most important thing is our employees, therefore we give constant training in different topics, as well as constantly looking for benefits that actively increase employee satisfaction. We always have challenging assignments waiting for skilled and dedicated engineers, so we invite you to join the team and be part of our family.
